text: data volumes are increasing at an
unprecedented rate exploding from
terabytes to even exabytes of data to
help manage these increases many
companies are taking their data from
silos and aggregating it in one location
a data lake to do analytics and machine
learning they're also using
purpose-built data stores such as data
warehouses to get quick results for
complex queries and that data can be
moved in multiple ways it can move
inside out where for example it moves
from the data lake to a data warehouse
outside in where data moves in the
opposite direction and around the
perimeter from one data store to another
that's a lot of movement and that's why
you need a modern data strategy on aws
it's all about integrating a data lake a
data warehouse and purpose-built stores
enabling unified governance and easy
data movement
at the center are scalable data lakes
amazon s3 is built to store and retrieve
any amount of data with unmatched
availability then there are the
purpose-built data services amazon
redshift provides super-fast results to
complex queries amazon open search
service lets you quickly log and search
analytics and amazon emr makes it easy
to process petabyte-scale data
aws offers these services and more
including relational and non-relational
databases as well as interactive query
tools
aws also allows you to easily move data
between the data lakes and purpose-built
data services enabling easy data access
wherever it's needed
with all these features governance is
easier too you can enforce access
controls from a single place for all
services
on top of all this you can get the best
performance at the lowest cost and aws
is continually innovating to improve the
price performance of our services
a modern data strategy on aws will help
you get insight from all your data to
all your users allowing you to build for
the future
to learn more go to aws.amazon.com
analytics
